intro: Reseda duriaeana var. papillosa, commonly known as the hairy reseda, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of southern Africa. It features slender, upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are lance-shaped and also bear a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas or along roadsides.
